meanings.sent1: The rainy weather was disinclining me from going outside.
meanings.sent2: His fear of heights disinclined him from trying the roller coaster.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics were disinclining the dog from taking a nap.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules at the school were disinclining students from breaking them.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the construction site was disinclining the birds from nesting nearby.

meanings.sent1: The warning signs were disinclining hikers from entering the dangerous trail.
meanings.sent2: The high prices of the items disinclined customers from making a purchase.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's strict grading policy was disinclining students from procrastinating on their assignments.
meanings.sent4: The constant criticism was disinclining him from pursuing his passion for painting.
meanings.sent5: The lack of support was disinclining her from pursuing her dreams of becoming a singer.
